Test driven development
or say all new functionality on an existing product should be unit tested first
*listening*
so, say project Y will take X days... don't say project Y will take X days, with TDD, but usually it'd be Z days without it
you don't know it'll take longer
do it first, then see if it's actually slower
theres the closest thing to proving you are right you will ever get to in software dev
lol
I see your problem, hard for me to think of suggestions though cause I didn't have to convince R (myboss) that we have to do it... so for me it was easy

it also helps to be honest with your team... no one wants to hear that what they're currently doing sucks. you're more likely to have them buy in if you're honest about telling them that writing tests is not easy and theyre going to have a hard time in the beginning, but that it will all pay off in the long run... hard to do without sounding like a preacher
